urls.title: Find out if you're at risk of flooding in England
urls.description: Check your risk of flooding: get current flood warnings, check the 5-day forecast or use flood maps

tweets.text:
#TeamEA have been protecting communities from flooding across the #NorthWest over the #Christmas period 

Here, the team have been clearing debris screens on Riding Gate Brook in #Bolton during #StormBella 

Do you know your flood risk? https://t.co/ZAITy41Ta6

#ReducingFloodRisk https://t.co/IwGU7tYTSD

domain.name: Holiday
domain.description: Holidays like Christmas or Halloween

entity.name: Christmas
entity.description: This entity includes all conversations for Christmas for all years.

tweets.text: The #Worcestershire field team supported by our framework #Contractors along with EA staff acting as #community information officers are removing the #Severn side south barrier and the Beales Corner temporary barrier today at #Bewdley @EnvAgencyMids #Covidsafe https://t.co/0Q71qEcEaa

domain.name: Ongoing News Story
domain.description: Ongoing News Stories like 'Brexit'

tweets.text:
While river levels remain high in parts of the #Midlands we're not expecting much rain over the coming days

Snow is hitting some areas but we're not expecting any impacts so over the next couple of days we're taking down #flood barriers

If needed we can quickly put them back up https://t.co/InkuliemK6

We had our drone out yesterday viewing  the extent of rainfall over the festive period #South Cerney #Oxford ‚Å¶@MarkHill03‚Å© ‚Å¶@EnvAgencySE‚Å© ‚Å¶@johncurtinEA‚Å© ‚Å¶@SteveMooreEA‚Å© ‚Å¶@wifo_ea‚Å© https://t.co/pRrPDp20p5

We've been using drone photography to gather data on the flooding event. This helps us assess the impact of our flood defences and manage our response.

It also gives us info to prepare for future incidents. 

This footage of Bedford was taken on Boxing Day.

#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/MoBOPJsboi

domain.name: Interests and Hobbies Vertical
domain.description: Top level interests and hobbies groupings, like Food or Travel

tweets.text:
River #flooding is possible in parts of central and east England.

Stay alert and keep away from flooded rivers.

Check your flood risk: https://t.co/BpUpnj1mdd https://t.co/53N5yBFIDE

When rivers are flooded, the current can be strong enough to sweep you away.

We're expecting further river #flooding across central and east England.
 
Check your #flood risk: https://t.co/BpUpnjiX4L https://t.co/QRCVJJglYb

You can tell that @DefraGovUK isn't serious about protecting our environment when you see that @EnvAgency funding for enforcement activity has halved in the past 10 years
https://t.co/OHEAQXcvZ4 
< no wonder industrial-scale #flytipping and pollution is rife.  Must #StopTheDrop

‚úÖ And in other news ‚úÖ 

The @EnvAgencyMids have now taken down then flood barriers on The Wharfage in #Ironbridge

We are waiting for the road & footpaths to be gritted after the snowfall in order to reopen the road providing full access to all shops, restaurants and pubs. https://t.co/hsg0RKhG2R

tweets.text:
Waste criminals pose as genuine waste collectors, take people's money, but dump waste illegally - hurting our environment.  

Help us prevent #WasteCrime.  

If you need to dispose of any rubbish, check your waste carrier is registered: https://t.co/0krpCgwQkt https://t.co/SkB7sPfwvv

@greenbeltsal @EnvAgency @YNET4 @EnvAgencyYNE @northyorkscc As someone who grew up in York, floods like these were at least a yearly event. Seemingly it is happening a lot more frequently now. 

But what is the link with EA and development which is causing this to happen more frequently?

@BarryKillnerEA @maggie_colledge @WorcsTravel @EnvAgencyMids I live at Severnside Mill and I can guarantee that my neighbours and fellow Bewdley dwellers would prefer a little inconvenience in the short term than their houses flooded when all of the melted Welsh snow comes cascading down the Severn in a day or two!

The #BurtonWashlands is a fantastic floodplain resource. By restoring the #natural features of the #floodplain we can improve its capacity to store flood water, capture carbon, purify water and support wildlife @eaststaffsbc @EnvAgencyMids #LetNatureHelp #Flooding #Floods https://t.co/eIDDLNvV49

Construction of the #Kendal Flood Risk Management Scheme will start in early 2021 and once complete will better protect 1,480 homes and 1,151 business in the town.
